metadata.Title: CVE-2022-3586 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s networking code. A use-after-free was found in the way the sch_sfb enqueue function used the socket buffer (SKB) cb field after the same SKB had been enqueued (and freed) into a child qdisc. This flaw allows a local, unprivileged user to crash the system, causing a denial of service. Gwnaun Jung discovered that the SFB packet scheduling implementation in the Linux kernel contained a use-after-free vulnerability. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3586` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-240-generic - 4.4.0-240.274
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-240-generic - 4.4.0-240.274
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-240-lowlatency - 4.4.0-240.274
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1156-aws - 4.4.0-1156.171
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1147-aws - 4.15.0-1147.159~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-240.274').

linux-aws-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1147.159~16.04.1').

linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1142.158~16.04.1').
